articles.author: FARNOUSH AMIRI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Former Rep. Matt Gaetz said Friday that he will not be returning to Congress after withdrawing his name from consideration to be attorney general under President-elect Donald Trump amid growing allegations of sexual misconduct.
articles.title: Matt Gaetz says he won't return to Congress next year after withdrawing name for attorney general

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — After several weeks working mostly behind closed doors, Vice President-elect JD Vance returned to Capitol Hill this week in a new, more visible role: Helping Donald Trump try to get his most contentious Cabinet picks to confirmation in the Senate, where Vance has served for the last two years.
articles.title: Vance takes on a more visible transition role, working to boost Trump's most contentious picks

articles.author: PETER SMITH
articles.description: A social-media tribute to Coptic Christians. A billboard in Amish country. A visit to a revered Jewish gravesite. While Donald Trump's lock on the white evangelical vote is legendary, he and his campaign allies also wooed smaller religious groups, far from the mainstream.
articles.title: Beyond evangelicals, Trump and his allies courted smaller faith groups, from the Amish to Chabad

articles.author: ILLIA NOVIKOV and VOLODYMYR YURCHUK
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — NATO and Ukraine will hold emergency talks Tuesday after Russia attacked a central city with an experimental, hypersonic ballistic missile that escalated the nearly 33-month-old war.
articles.title: NATO and Ukraine to hold emergency talks after Russia's attack with new hypersonic missile

articles.author: NADIA LATHAN and KENDRIA LAFLEUR
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Texas’ education board voted Friday to allow Bible-infused teachings in elementary schools under optional new curriculum that could test boundaries between religion and public classrooms in the U.S.
articles.title: Texas education board approves optional Bible-infused curriculum for elementary schools

articles.author: MARK VANCLEAVE and MICHAEL GOLDBERG
articles.description: FERGUS FALLS, Minn. (AP) — A jury convicted two men on Friday of charges related to human smuggling for their roles in an international operation that led to the deaths of a family of Indian migrants who froze while trying to cross the Canada-U.S.
articles.title: 2 convicted in human smuggling case after Indian family froze to death on US-Canada border

articles.author: NOAH BERGER and OLGA R. RODRIGUEZ
articles.description: HEALDSBURG, Calif. (AP) — Heavy rain from a major storm prompted evacuation warnings for communities near a Northern California river that was flooding Friday, as the system continued to dump heavy snow in mountainous areas where some ski resorts opened for the season.
articles.title: Storm inundates Northern California with rain, heavy snow. Thousands remain in the dark in Seattle

articles.author: CHRISTINA LARSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Long before the ancient Maya built temples, their predecessors were already altering the landscape of Central America’s Yucatan peninsula.
articles.title: Archaeologists discover 4,000-year-old canals used to fish by predecessors of ancient Maya

articles.author: MIKE STOBBE and JONEL ALECCIA
articles.description: Health officials on Friday confirmed bird flu in a California child — the first reported case in a U.S. minor.The child had mild symptoms, was treated with antiviral medication and is recovering, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in announcing the test results.
articles.title: California case is the first confirmed bird flu infection in a US child

articles.author: GABRIELA SÁ PESSOA and MAURICIO SAVARESE
articles.description: SAO PAULO (AP) — Brazil’s federal police on Thursday formally accused former President Jair Bolsonaro and 36 other people of attempting a coup to keep him in office after his defeat in the 2022 elections.
articles.title: Brazilian police formally accuse former President Bolsonaro and aides of alleged 2022 coup attempt
